title: Beginner English 108
headline: This free online English speaking course covers vocabulary describing household objects and the ‘prepositions of place’.
description: This English speaking course builds on the skills you need to master the English language. We teach you the pronunciation of words and how to link the consonant 's' to vowel sounds. The course's grammar component explains when to use 'there is' or 'there are' and helps you form questions using 'how many?' We then move on to the 'prepositions of place' and provide the vocabulary to help you name household objects and rooms.
courseDescription:
We have designed this English speaking course to help you learn this global language at a basic level. The courses cover all the basic pronunciation, grammar, and vocabulary needed to give you the confidence to develop your English skills. We use audio and video files to guide and enhance your learning experience.

This course explains how to link the consonant 's' to vowel sounds in verbs, plural nouns, possessive nouns, and contractions. We show you how the voiceless 's' combines with vowel sounds and compare it to the voiced 'z,' followed by the combinations of 's,' 'z,' 'sh,' 'zh,' 'ch,' 'j' and 'iz' with vowels. We then contrast voiced and unvoiced consonants. The course demonstrates when to use 'there is' and 'there are' and teaches you how to ask and answer questions using 'how many.'

Finally, we show you how to apply the 'prepositions of place': 'in,' 'at,' and 'on.' The course lays out vocabulary relating to household objects and rooms to let you describe locations like bathrooms and living rooms as you discuss common household objects like appliances and tools. This course will help you master the basics of English and boost your confidence.
